title: How to Make a Fruity Chicken Salad Sandwich

steps.headline: Mix together the chicken, celery, onion, grapes, and garlic in a bowl.
steps.description: Make sure everything is equally distributed. Add chopped walnuts for more texture. If you want a fruitier sandwich, add more grapes or some other fruits. Chopped oranges, pineapple or exotic feijoa would make interesting additions.

steps.headline: Add to the bowl mayonnaise or your favorite salad dressing.
steps.description: Use enough to coat all the chicken, celery, grapes etc. A fruity Vinaigrette would go well here.

steps.headline: Add seasonings to taste.
steps.description: A pinch of salt, some white pepper or some freshly ground black pepper. You can add a few chilli flakes if you like to spice up your sandwiches.

steps.headline: Cut or take two slices of bread from your loaf or cut your bread rolls in half.
steps.description: Butter the bread, or spread on some margarine if you wish. Alternatively, you can add your favorite crotons to the mixture and eat it as a conventional salad instead of in a sandwich.

steps.headline: Spread your fruity chicken salad mixture onto one slice of your bread or one half of your roll.
steps.description: Top the bread with the other slice to close your sandwich. If you like, serve with bread on the side.

text: Mix together the chicken, celery, onion, grapes, and garlic in a bowl. Make sure everything is equally distributed. Add chopped walnuts for more texture. If you want a fruitier sandwich, add more grapes or some other fruits. Chopped oranges, pineapple or exotic feijoa would make interesting additions. Add to the bowl mayonnaise or your favorite salad dressing. Use enough to coat all the chicken, celery, grapes etc. A fruity Vinaigrette would go well here. Add seasonings to taste. A pinch of salt, some white pepper or some freshly ground black pepper. You can add a few chilli flakes if you like to spice up your sandwiches. Cut or take two slices of bread from your loaf or cut your bread rolls in half. Butter the bread, or spread on some margarine if you wish. Alternatively, you can add your favorite crotons to the mixture and eat it as a conventional salad instead of in a sandwich. Spread your fruity chicken salad mixture onto one slice of your bread or one half of your roll. Top the bread with the other slice to close your sandwich. If you like, serve with bread on the side.
